title: Democratic Presidential Candidates Seek to Build Support in South Carolina
text:
FLORENCE, S.C.—Democratic presidential candidates laid out competing visions across South Carolina this weekend as they sought to build support in the first Southern state on next year’s primary calendar.

Former Vice President Joe Biden and Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren appeared in this community of nearly 40,000 people in the state’s Pee Dee region Saturday. Mr. Biden, helped by strong support among black voters who make up about 60% of the primary electorate in South Carolina, holds a dominant position here, according...
description: The presidential hopefuls laid out competing visions across South Carolina this weekend as they sought to build support in the first Southern state on next year’s primary calendar.
